description_txt: stated on December 6, 2010 in a press conference:
quote_txt: Says the military accounts for about 10 percent of Florida's economy.

description_txt: stated on December 7, 2010 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "There are polls showing right now that the American people for the most part think it's a bad idea to provide tax cuts to the wealthy."

description_txt: stated on November 16, 2010:
quote_txt: Republicans "created a trillion dollar prescription drug entitlement program without paying for it."

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2010 in a program at the Marquette University Law School:
quote_txt: "It’s illegal for a state to say we’re simply going to cut off (union contract) negotiations. There’s a legal requirement that you are involved in good faith bargaining."

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2010 in an MSNBC interview :
quote_txt: "Understand, this is unemployment insurance. It’s not welfare, as a lot of my Republican colleagues like to suggest it is. You pay into it when you’re working. You get help when you’re not."

description_txt: stated on November 22, 2010 in a book:
quote_txt: The city of Atlanta ranks 25th among U.S. cities with the highest crime rates.

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2010 in a web video.:
quote_txt: "In Florida, illegal immigration costs taxpayers nearly $4 billion (a year). This amounts to $700 for every household in Florida."

description_txt: stated on December 4, 2010 in the Senate floor:
quote_txt: "The senior senator from Arizona (John McCain) said he couldn't support repealing 'don't ask, don't tell' because of the economy."

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2010 in an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: The Pentagon's survey about the "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" policy found that 92 percent of service members "agree that they could serve ... in a unit in combat" without compromising "mission readiness."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2010 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: The DREAM Act the "would give amnesty to over two million illegal aliens."

description_txt: stated on November 29, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: In Wisconsin, "6.2 percent of the population is black yet 24 percent of all state abortions are on African-Americans."

description_txt: stated on November 10, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: "We are giving almost $2 billion of taxpayer money to the junk food and fast food industries every year to make the (childhood obesity) epidemic worse."

description_txt: stated on November 22, 2010 in a letter:
quote_txt: A National Football League lockout would cost Atlanta $160 million in lost jobs and revenue.

description_txt: stated on November 29, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: "In 2009, Jim Doyle and the Democrats rushed through a budget repair bill with billions in tax increases and held no public hearings."

description_txt: stated on November 12, 2010 in a KLRU interview:
quote_txt: "Barack Obama's health care bill is nothing new. Mitt Romney signed one just like it four years before."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in a commentary in The Providence Journal:
quote_txt: Measures taken by my administration "have saved taxpayers $1 billion."

description_txt: stated on November 15, 2010 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Says more than $3.5 billion in state revenue that is supposed to be dedicated to basic needs and functions is being diverted to "make the books look balanced."

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Last year, Beaverton School District had the highest number of homeless students ever recorded in Oregon.

description_txt: stated on November 29, 2010 in a report on his past accomplishments as Tampa mayor:
quote_txt: "Refinanced $232.6 million in bonds, resulting in reduced debt service for the City."

description_txt: stated on November 13, 2010 in in a radio interview.:
quote_txt: "There’s talk in Congress now about basically confiscating your private 401(k) or IRA plan and rolling it into Social Security to strengthen Social Security."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2010 in an interview on CNN.:
quote_txt: On offshore oil drilling.

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2010 in a statement:
quote_txt: Says the CBO estimates that fully extending the Bush tax cuts would add 600,000-1.4 million jobs in 2011 and 900,000-2.7 million jobs in 2012.

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2010 in an interview on NPR:
quote_txt: "I have won more elections than any chairman since 1938."

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2010 in an interview with a weekly newspaper:
quote_txt: Says he got twice as much money from the sale of County Grounds land than Milwaukee County Executive Scott Walker was willing to accept.

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2010 in National Review Online:
quote_txt: Said Republicans made historic gains in state legislatures during last month’s election

description_txt: stated on November 11, 2010 in a Web post.:
quote_txt: In "the fall of 2009, only 21 percent of Texas high school graduates enrolled in a four-year public university."

description_txt: stated on November 22, 2010 in his radio broadcast:
quote_txt: "This town (Wilmington, Ohio) hasn’t taken any money from the government. They don’t want any money from the government."

description_txt: stated on November 27, 2010 in an appearance on WPRI-12's Newsmakers:
quote_txt: Providence teachers "can go five or six years without an evaluation."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2010 in comments to reporters:
quote_txt: "The American people spoke pretty loudly. They said stop all the looming tax hikes...."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2010 in a newspaper interview.:
quote_txt: Hillsborough's Public Transportation Commission has "a rule that says cabbies have to wear socks. I mean, please. Come on."
